parking: Avenida Marítima and walk up.

bus.notes: Walk up along Calle O'Daly (Antigua Calle Real)

notes: Bus interchange.

parking: Plenty of street parking in Barlovento. Car park near tourist information office.
notes: Bus interchange.

parking: Very restricted narrow streets with practically no parking options.
Multiple small places, try Calle Vicente San Juan round the back of the big church.
None
taxi: 4WD taxis carrying 8 passengers run from the taxi hut near the finish to Casa del Monte. Book in advance.

parking: Some parking by the hut, more up the road.

notes: Bus interchange

parking: Free (sizable) car park

notes: There is a small beach near the lighthouses.

parking: Street parking

parking: Some free spaces before the entrance or in the carpark if you have a visitor centre ticket.

notes: The volcano is a short walk down from Los Canarios

parking: Plenty of spaces at the recreation area.
notes: Accessed from a froestry path off the LP-2 road. Enquire at Los Canarios information centre for track conditions.

parking: Multiple nearby parking spots.
notes: Taxis run from Centro de Visitante.

parking: Parking spots up Calle Campanario and more further on up the track.
notes: Small village but with tiny shop and Pizzeria Evangelina

parking: Some parking by the church, more up Calle Tamanca by the Virgen de Fátima shrine.

bus.notes: Stop is opposite the El Americano bar

notes: You can walk to Centro de Interpretación del tubo volcánico Cueva de Las Palomas from here.

parking: Large car park at the rear, some parking in the front.
notes: On the LP-3 road about half way between El Paso and the Cumbre Nueva tunnel.

parking: Car park at the rear of Plaza de Bujaz
notes: Has an attractive plaza and some good restaurants.

parking: Parking spot by a wall at the start along Calle Cuesta de la Juliana.
notes: Tacande is within walking distance of El Paso

parking: A couple of spaces where the tarmac ends, more at the notice board further up the track.
notes: Taxi from Centro de Visitantes to the end of the tarmac.

parking: Two small car parks.
notes: Book in advance on the official website or come out of hours. Barrier on the approach road.

parking: Small car park at the mirador.
notes: The road from La Viña car park is wether dependent, and very narrow. Take a taxi.

parking: Ample spaces unless it's the holidays
notes: Shared taxis from La Viña car park run from 8:00 to 13:00 (12:00 autumn/winter) and charge 51€ per car seating 4 people
Beach-like area on the Rio de Taburiente

parking: Fairly small and busy car park.
notes: Three viewpoints can be accessed from a path leading from the car park.
Viewpoint accessed up a steep slippery slope.
Spectacular viewpoint where the Caldera meets into the Cumbre Nueva
Roadside parking spots near the PR LP 07/GR 131 intersection
Parking spot just off the LP-4 road where the PR LP 03 path intersects.

parking: Plentiful parking but gets busy on market days.
notes: Popular flea market in the plaza on Sundays.

parking: Car park near the bus station and elsewhere.

bus.notes: Bus station has some grotty toilets

parking: Limited parking for restaurant patrons only
Beachfront places fill up fast but there's a carpark further up Calle Taburiente.
Cervecería Isla Verde bar carpark.
A couple of places directly in front and a car park opposite.
notes: Recreational area with water just a short walk from El Jesus.

parking: Layby by the wall with space for several cars
Street parking, more by the sports stadium.

parking: Next to Bar Garome.
Two sizable parking spots at the end of Camino La Ermita.

parking: Street parking

bus.notes: You can walk to Puntagorda just up the road.

notes: Self-contained village and bus interchange.

parking: Plentiful, except at the weekends and holidays when there is a market.

notes: Recreation area with nearby market. Short walk from El Pinar.

parking: Adequate street parking nearby.

bus.notes: Bus interchange is at El Pinar, one stop further on.

parking: Small parking spot by a noticeboard.
notes: Nearby miradors and picnic area.

parking: None
notes: Only accessible by foot. On the GR 130 path between Las Tricias and Cuevas de Buracas.

parking: A couple of small car parks.
notes: Tiny place but with restaurants and an tourist information centre.

parking: At the museum (included in ticket price or free on Mondays when the museum is closed) or roadside a little way down.
notes: Look for the big stone head statue by the side of the road.

parking: In the recreational area.
notes: Picnic area, campsite, church and agricultural centre. Usually very busy or nearly empty.

parking: By the stadium or along Calle Nueva.
By the tourist information centre and various street options.
notes: Tiny place but has a shop, har and tourist information centre.

parking: Quite a large car park and a few spots on the approach road.
notes: Popular with locals. Petroglyphs on the walk down.

parking: Not really.
notes: Taxi about 20€ to Santo domingo and 15€ to La Zarza

parking: Small, limited street parking on very narrow roads

notes: Ship museum, restaurants etc.
